other_tests.findings: Four patients recovered from postoperative hypoparathyroidism after treatment with PTH (1–84). Recovery was observed with serum calcium and PTH levels within the normal range off therapy.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Recovery from hypoparathyroidism occurred 8 to 16 years after initial diagnosis, with serum calcium remaining stable off PTH therapy after treatment duration of 36 to 63 months.

other_tests.date: Various, including study entry dates from 2004 to 2007, with follow-up tests noted in 2009, 2011, and 2013.
other_tests.findings: Laboratory data included undetectable to low PTH levels at study entry, with subsequent measurements showing serum calcium and PTH levels returning to the normal range.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Patients showed a decrease in calcium supplementation requirements over time. Notable improvements included increased PTH levels and stable serum calcium measurements after PTH therapy was discontinued.
